definition: to report a case to the authorities
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
(legal) case/incident/record/file/table
Qing's 1903 suppression of revolutionary calls in newspaper 蘇報|苏报, leading to imprisonment of Zhang Taiyan 章太炎 and Zou Rong 鄒容|邹容

sentences.english: I'm not afraid, laughing after reading text messages on the deletion, and also not to report.
sentences.chinese: 我一点都不怕，笑着看完短信就删了，也没去报案。

sentences.english: If you want to report the crime to the police, do so.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想到公安局报案，就报吧。

sentences.english: His coup of early this morning had been reported.
sentences.chinese: 他今天一清早干的好事已经报案了。

sentences.english: When cross-examined, to determine the liability insurance companies.
sentences.chinese: 接到报案后，保险公司确定了保险责任。

sentences.english: Simmons: Your son filed a stolen car report last night.
sentences.chinese: 你儿子昨晚报案说他的车被盗了。

sentences.english: It is reported, reports after Chen soon, this maid also arrives thepolice headquarters to report.
sentences.chinese: 据了解，在陈报案后不久，该女佣亦到警署报案。

sentences.english: It is reported, reports after Chen soon, this maid also arrives thepolice headquarters to report.
sentences.chinese: 据了解，在陈报案后不久，该女佣亦到警署报案。

sentences.english: A young man came to Scottie's office with a story.
sentences.chinese: 一个年轻人来到科特斯的办公室报案。

sentences.english: In October police rejected his brother's effort to register him as a missing person.
sentences.chinese: 他哥哥10月欲报案寻弟弟却遭警方拒绝受理。

sentences.english: The Red Cross reported Ms. Guo to the police on June 24.
sentences.chinese: 6月24日，红十字会向警方就郭美美报案。

sentences.english: Ms Zhang must have been hesitated and struggled on whether reporting to the authority or not .
sentences.chinese: 报案还是不报案，张某肯定徘徊和犹豫过。

sentences.english: Ms Zhang must have been hesitated and struggled on whether reporting to the authority or not .
sentences.chinese: 报案还是不报案，张某肯定徘徊和犹豫过。

sentences.english: However, it did not report the matter the police will have no check.
sentences.chinese: 但由于对方没有报案，此事警方无从查证。

sentences.english: He reported his wifes disappearance to the police.
sentences.chinese: 他将他太太的失踪向警方报案。

sentences.english: A young man came to Scotti's office with a story.
sentences.chinese: 一个年轻人来到斯科特的办公室报案。

sentences.english: Someone reported, heard gunshots, he decided to go to the site investigation.
sentences.chinese: 有人报案，听到枪声，安哥决定到现场调查。

definition: to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
police
local police station
victim
(of police, fire brigade etc) to receive a report of an incident
public security bureau
victim (of a criminal)/party involved (in a dispute etc)/main instigator
to surrender to the authorities/to turn oneself in (for a crime)
to file for investigation/to prosecute (a case)
to dispatch police to the scene of crime, accident etc
to give oneself up/to surrender (to the authorities)
to be informed of a case/to take a case/to contract for a job (as a freelancer)
a suspect
to alert/to warn/police
to register (to an official organism)/to file a case (for investigation)
to obtain (information from an archive etc)
